intro: Pisonia florida var. pabstiana, commonly known as the Pabst's pisonia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or red in color. The plant produces small, winged fruits that are dispersed by wind, a feature common in many species of the genus Pisonia. It thrives in coastal areas and is often found in sandy or limestone soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in tropical gardens.
